resources.string:
"Your nominated pharmacy %1s is a Smart Pharmacy. This means they can share updates about where your repeat medication is at any moment via Patient Access.
If you want to activate your Smart Pharmacy, we need to safely store your NHS number from your GP records. Your NHS number is a unique number used across many healthcare systems to identify you and it’s required for us to let you know when your medication is ready. You’ll be able to remove your NHS number from your Patient Access account at any moment. More information on how we use your data is available in our Privacy policy"

Activate your Smart Pharmacy prompt card

"We know it can be difficult to remember to take your medication exactly as prescribed. This can mean it won’t work as effectively as it should. For this reason, we’d like to share with you information to help you better manage your medication.
If you’ve linked your Patient Access account to your GP practice, we’ll use details of your medication and medical conditions from your electronic health record.
Any medication information you’ll receive by turning on Patient Access Medication Assistant will be tailored to the medication you’re currently taking.
We won’t share any of your personal data with anyone unless legally required to do so. We may share anonymised statistical data with third parties. For more details about how we use your personal information, see our Privacy Policy external link"

Please be aware that the following services are not provided by your GP practice and include treatments that you’ll need to pay for as they’re delivered on a private basis. You’ll always be informed of the costs when choosing the service provider. Some of these services are available on the NHS via your GP practice and you can also browse NHS services at www.nhs.uk. external link
Use your NHS number prompt card
Find services by area external link
By nominating a pharmacy your prescriptions will be sent electronically to your pharmacy of choice.
Your prescriptions will be sent electronically to your nominated pharmacy. You may change your nominated pharmacy at any time.

You’ll also be able to use your email address instead of your User ID to sign in to Patient Access."

"Please note that your account has limited access to your GP practice's online services and you can only book one GP appointment. You’ll gain full access to your GP practice's online services when your GP practice verifies your identity."
Once you have confirmed your identity with your practice, you can access the following features where your practice supports them:
To link to your practice, please enter the following details from your registration letter. If you do not have a registration letter, please select the ’No’ button above.

Your email address is invalid. Please check the format
In order to receive updates from your pharmacy on your repeat medication orders, we need to safely store your NHS number from your GP records.

Your NHS number is a unique number used across many healthcare systems to identify you and it’s required for us to let you know when your medication is ready. You’ll be able to remove your NHS number from your Patient Access account at any time. More information on how we use your data is available in our Privacy policy
If you have an NHS login, you can use it to link your GP practice to your Patient Access account. You can also use this option to create your NHS login.

NHS login is a service created by the NHS for people registered at a GP practice in England. It provides a way for you to access multiple digital health and social care services with a single set of login authentication details.
If you have a verified NHS login, you can use it to securely link your GP practice to Patient Access without the need to contact or visit your GP practice.

"If you don’t have an NHS login or your NHS login is not verified, you need to complete the necessary NHS login verification steps before you can link your GP practice. Once your NHS login is verified, you’ll be able to come back to this page and link your GP practice to Patient Access to start using your GP practice's online services. If you have already linked your GP practice to your Patient Access account in the past, please contact your GP practice to get a new registration letter. You will then be able to use NHS login or the registration letter details to link your GP practice to your Patient Access account again."
You can read the Patient Access Privacy Policy to learn how your information will be used and read more on NHS Digital’s Terms and Conditions.
Sorry, at the moment this provider has no available times.
Sorry, at the moment this provider has no available times.

"You can now receive updates about where your medication order is at any time by nominating a Smart Pharmacy.
Smart Pharmacies are a type of pharmacy available in Patient Access which offer medication order tracking services. When you nominate a Smart Pharmacy, you can track your medication every step of the way in Patient Access, from the moment you request it from your GP practice to the minute your pharmacy finishes preparing it."
Sorry, we could not find any pharmacy near this location.

Please note that if you change your nominated pharmacy, any previous medication orders approved by your GP that have not yet been dispensed by your current pharmacy will now be dispensed by your new nominated pharmacy. Your new pharmacy will help you with any outstanding medication.

Patient Access now provides access to a wider choice of healthcare services from partners that you can pay for online. You can manage your payment details below.

"Your practice has disabled online access. If your practice has recently merged with another practice and has issued you with a new registration letter, please use the details in this letter to link to your new merged practice. If you haven't received a new registration letter, please contact your practice to request one."

Please be aware that the following services are not provided by your GP practice and include treatments that you’ll need to pay for as they’re delivered on a private basis. You’ll always be informed of the costs when choosing the service provider. Some of these services are available on the NHS via your GP practice and you can also browse NHS services at www.nhs.uk.
these services are not provided by your GP practice and include private paid for treatments.

You have to be age 16 years and over to use the service.

"A registration letter contains important information required to register for full access to online services.
If you do not have a registration letter you can select the ’No’ button above and continue with basic online access, which will allow you to book a single appointment. You can also contact your practice directly to find out the options available to you to verify your identity and get full access."

Why do we ask for this information?
In order to register your new Patient Access account we need some basic information to get you set up with your correct details and provide relevant information about the service.

"The registration letter contains a Linkage Key and an Account ID, which you’ll need to provide in Patient Access when linking your GP practice with a registration letter. Example of a registration letter containing the Linkage Key and Account ID:"

The details you have entered do not match the details stored on your practice system. Please check these details and try again. If you are still unsuccessful please contact your practice for assistance.

"A registration letter is a document that your GP practice can issue for you. It contains the necessary information to link your GP practice to Patient Access and start using your GP practice's online services. You’ll need two forms of identification to obtain a registration letter: one with your photograph (for example, a driving licence or passport), and another one with your current address (for example, a credit card or bank statement)."

"Note that utility bills will not be accepted as a form of identification. If you cannot provide evidence of your identity, you can speak to your GP practice about your situation. Please be aware that you can only use a registration letter once. Your GP practice can issue you a new registration letter if you need one. "
Sorry, your practice does not currently support Patient Access
To link to your practice, please enter the following details from your registration letter. If you do not have a registration letter, please contact your practice to obtain one.

To begin the registration process, please call your practice or visit them in person. They will advise you of the next step to take. You will need to provide proof of identity at some point: your practice will also advise you when this will be required. Once your practice has supplied you with a registration letter you can return here to complete the registration process.
" You can call your practice on this number: "

Exporting your medical record does not include any date range filters you may have applied. Exported files will contain sensitive information from your medical record. It is your responsibility to ensure that any files you download are stored securely and protected from unauthorized access. By exporting and downloading files from Patient Access, you agree to the

Sharing your medical record does not include any date range filters you may have applied. It generates a secure web page that you can share with a health professional or relative for 24 hours. You can stop sharing your medical record at any time.
If you sign out from Patient Access, you’ll need to enter your username and password the next time you sign in. Instead, you can lock the app and use your fingerprint to unlock the app next time.

Contact your doctor online and get health advice

"Proxy access allows parents, family members, carers, care home staff, to have access to their patients’ online services accounts, in order to book appointments, request repeat medication and where applicable, view their medical record.
The level of access is configured per patient for each proxy user, as they may care for more than one patient and need different levels of access.
The first time you register the proxy user as a new online user, a PIN document will be issued to provide them with sign in credentials. They will be linked to the patient and have access to the services specified at the point of registration. Once they are a registered online user, if they are linked to a further patient, no further PIN document is issued or required. The next time they sign in with their existing credentials, their account will have automatically been updated to include the further patient(s). To select any account for the further management, just select appropriate account and click on “Switch” control."

"We know it can be difficult to remember to take your medication exactly as prescribed. This can mean it won’t work as effectively as it should. For this reason, we’d like to share with you information to help you better manage your medication.
If you’ve linked your Patient Access account to your GP practice, we’ll use details of your medication and medical conditions from your electronic health record.
Any medication information you’ll receive by turning on Patient Access Medication Assistant will be tailored to the medication you’re currently taking.
We won’t share any of your personal data with anyone unless legally required to do so. We may share anonymised statistical data with third parties. For more details about how we use your personal information, see our Privacy Policy"
Your Medication Assistant is turned off.

Turning off this feature will mean you will no longer receive any content, information or reminders about your medication. If you just want to turn off notifications or emails related to your medication, you can modify your preferences in the Communication Preferences area instead.

"Patient Access Memorable Word is an 8–20 characters word or phrase that only you will know once you have set it up. This is an additional layer of security which helps us to keep your account and medical record more secure.
Please choose your Memorable Word carefully. It should be a word or phrase that you can remember but which cannot be easily guessed by someone else.
You can also set up a hint which can remind you of your Memorable Word but the hint should not make the word easily guessable to anyone else.
It is very important to keep this information safe and not share it with anyone."

"You can now receive updates about where your medication order is at any time by nominating a Smart Pharmacy.
Smart Pharmacies are a type of pharmacy available in Patient Access which offer medication order tracking services.
When you nominate a Smart Pharmacy, you'll be able to track your medication every step of the way in Patient Access, from the moment you request it from your GP practice to the minute your pharmacy prepares your order and marks it as ready for collection or out for delivery."

In order to receive updates from your pharmacy on your repeat medication orders, we need to safely store your NHS number from your GP records. Your NHS number is a unique number used across many healthcare systems to identify you and it’s required for us to let you know when your medication is ready. More information on how we use your data is available in our Privacy policy
To verify this mobile number enter the verification code below.
